data.title: About / Services
data.text:
Matthew Helderman founded Buffalo 8 in 2010, while an undergrad student. Buffalo 8 has since premiered projects at Sundance, SXSW, and Berlin, as well as produced the Netflix original film “Rodney King” directed by Spike Lee and the Joe Berlinger directed Netflix global hit “The Jeffrey Dahmer Tapes”. In 2013, he co-founded BondIt Media Capital and has led BondIt in the deployment of over $375M of capital in over 400+ film, television, and media opportunities, while raising $30M of equity and debt for a partial sale to Accord Financial (TSX: ACD) in addition to expanding the company’s credit facility to $75M in 2020. Helderman also co-managed the acquisition of 30-year-old entertainment payroll firm, ABS Payroll, in 2017 and today serves as an Executive Director, Partner, and Board Member after having overseen the sale of the business to Vensure Employer Services.

Luke is the co-founder and COO of both Buffalo 8 and BondIt Media Capital. Taylor oversees the financing operations and client management of both businesses on a daily basis. Taylor graduated from the University of Southern California with a B.S. in Music Industry and Business.

Donald is the CFO of BondIt Media Capital. McGreal previously held senior finance positions at several media, entertainment, and technology companies including Hulu and Awesomeness. He led finance and treasury teams through significant business expansion as well as multiple corporate transactions and capital raises. McGreal began his career in investment banking with Wells Fargo Securities. He graduated from Indiana University with a Bachelor of Science in Finance from the Kelley School of Business.

Tyler joined BondIt Media Capital in 2018 and today serves as the VP of Finance and Development. Tyler is an integral member of the deal team, taking point in negotiating, structuring, and contracting deals in addition to risk analysis, business development, and other ongoing operations. Gould also oversees the internal development slate of projects by reviewing, developing, and packaging projects for original productions. Gould has a background in film production and finance, graduating with degrees in Radio/Television/Film and Economics from Northwestern University.

Grady Craig is the SVP of Business Development at BondIt Media Capital and President of its sister company Buffalo 8. Since joining the company in 2018, Grady has since supported $200M of aggregate investment into over 200 film, television, and live music touring projects at BondIt, helped scale Buffalo 8’s production services revenue by sevenfold, and launched wide-scale operational systems across each business unit within the organization, including ABS Payroll, their 35-year-old sister company, which was sold in late 2022 to a Stone Point Capital private equity backed acquirer. Grady’s role is key to expanding the organizations’ international presence, integrating new M&A opportunities, and growing its overall media portfolio as the company expands deeper into music, live entertainment, and digital content. He oversees select single- and multi-picture opportunities with a focus on high-level business development, operational management, and leadership across the organizations. Grady has spoken at events around the world, from the American Film Market to the Cannes Film Festival, and holds dual degrees in Economics and Film Studies, with a concentration in Entrepreneurship from Boston College.

Tim assists with overseeing and designing marketing content for BondIt and its family of companies. Additionally, he helps potential clients identify the best BondIt and Buffalo 8 services for their projects, and he manages the Company Internship Program each semester. Tim holds a degree in Business Administration, with a concentration in Marketing and a minor in Philosophy, from Boston College.

Julie spent several years in real estate and lending leveraging her expertise in e-commerce and deal-making as an M&A Advisor with The FBA Broker/Summit Capital. Building upon her extensive experience in real estate, lending, and M&A, as well as a lifelong love of film and entertainment, Julie applies her expertise to help oversee the BondIt Media Capital loan portfolio as a Portfolio Servicer. In this role, she ensures optimal performance, communication, and effective risk management. Additionally, she supports the BondIt family of companies across business development at Buffalo 8 Post-Production, further utilizing her skills in deal-making and relationship building to help drive growth and success for the company.

Max is a Financial Analyst at BondIt, where he plays a crucial role on the deal team. He excels in managing all aspects of deal processes, from origination to closing and beyond. With a strong specialization in financial modeling, risk analysis, underwriting, and automation, Max brings a comprehensive skill set to the team. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics from Penn State University.

Peter joined in 2024 and is a financial analyst for BondIt Media Capital. He assists the deal team by compiling underwriting info, creating models, and prepping legal documents throughout the negotiation process. He also provides back-end financial support to ensure the company’s financials are up-to-date and accurate. Peter graduated in 2024 from Loyola Marymount University with a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance.

Brad was the co-founder and CEO of Aver Media LLP, a private debt financier specializing in film and television production and corporate financing. Brad managed the sale of Aver Media to Bank of Montreal in 2013, where he then served as the executive head of Media lending before retiring in 2019. Today Brad serves on a number of media, entertainment, and financing related Boards.

Irene is a member of the executive leadership team at Accord, focusing on all aspects of capital markets, including sourcing, closing and managing financing relationships. She is responsible for planning and securing Accord’s financing requirements by diversifying its sources of capital.

Irene’s most recent experience was as Senior Vice President at DBRS, and prior to that at GE Capital. She has her law degree from Fordham University and is a certified public accountant.

Mick was a former placekicker for the NFL’s Atlanta Falcons for nearly a decade and an on-air TV personality. Mick brings more than 20 years of entrepreneurial, insurance, and marketing experience to the BondIt Advisory Board. Mick served as CEO for the sports and media insurance firm American Hole ’n One from 1994 to 2017.
